document.docAuthor: Machado, Renato Jose Pires & Oswald, John David
document.masterDocTitle: Morphological phylogeny and taxonomic revision of the former antlion subtribe Periclystina (Neuroptera: Myrmeleontidae: Dendroleontinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphological phylogeny and taxonomic revision of the former antlion subtribe Periclystina (Neuroptera: Myrmeleontidae: Dendroleontinae)

paragraph.keyLead:
- Profemur ≥ 3.5x length of procoxa; pronotum longer than wide ( Figs. 97b , 104b )......... (
cahillensis
species group) … 2

4 (1) Profemur sense hair absent; tibial spurs absent or short (not reaching T1 apex; but reaching T1 apex in
M. rebellis
); male gonarcus/mediuncus complex not semi-triangular in outline (dorsal view); male paramere well developed ( Fig. 118b )........................................................................... (
pentagrammus
species group) … 5

- Profemur sense hair present; tibial spurs present and long (reaching T1 apex; but absent in
M. drysdalensis
); male gonarcus/ mediuncus complex semi-triangular in outline (dorsal view); male paramere absent or reduced (very thin, straight and entirely or mostly hidden beneath the gonarcus/mediuncus complex, in dorsal view) ( Fig.134c ).....(
stigmatus
species group) … 15

- Forewing mediocubital area entirely brown ( Fig. 108c )...........................................
M. lulinguensis
- Body mostly pale to orange, with small black areas........................................................ 18

- Forewing subcostal and mediocubital areas with a series of dark rounded marks ( Fig. 122c ); female terminalia: ventral membrane with numerous long thickened setae ( Fig. 123f ).......................................
M. punctatus
sp. nov.

19 (18) Female pregenital plate conically invaginated ( Figs. 130 e–f); male gonarcus/mediuncus complex elongate, completely covering paramere in dorsal view ( Fig. 130c )................................................................. 20

20 (19) Interantennal area mostly black ( Fig. 129a ); male paramere not visible in lateral view ( Fig. 130b ); female posterior gonapophysis absent; female 7 th sternite: posterior margin bearing two setose plates (
Fig. 130g
)...................
M. roseipennis

21 (19’) Supra-antennal area mostly pale to orange ( Fig. 93a ); profemur and basal abdominal segments with numerous long white setae.......................................................................................
M. banksi

- Supra-antennal area mostly black ( Fig. 120a ); profemur and basal abdominal segments with short white setae and a few long black setae.............................................................................
M. pingrupensis
